front.p: unknown date: unknown person, probably to Octavius Hadfield

body.p: in November to bring out his wife & daughter to settle here or in the island of St John's during the remainder of his days. Should my letter for Europe arrive before I do you will know her superscription I need not caution you against opening it. We were escorted to the water by the pipes playing alternately "The Frasers" & our March, to the no small entertainment of the people of Windsor. We proceeded on our journey through the townships of Horton & Cornwallis, which last is about six miles from Windsor, accompanied by the Major & handsome Jack, through a country if possible exceeding Windsor. Here another instance of the Major's attention [met?] us, he sent his servant the day before to Capt Campbell who is stationed here, announcing our arrival, this gentleman not wishing as travellers to take us out of our way, & knowing how ill the taverns on the road are supplied, with liquor, met us in his carriage with claret, Madiera, & Port, of the best quality from his own cellars. Though we might have proceeded much further thence daily the company & liquor were so good that we agreed to spend the night here, which we did much to our satisfaction. - Here the honest Major & Captain left us with the promise to be with us next morning, before we set off. A promise we afterwards understood they never intended to fulfil, & was given to avoid the disagreeable ceremony of leave taking.
